Australia has Blue-ringed Octopuses that are tiny but DEADLY. Regular octopuses seldom bother humans which is why this story is so widespread HOWEVER, there is ANOTHER cephalopod that attacks humans and that is the Humboldt Squid that lives down in the Gulf of California right off the Baja peninsula. These squid have hooks in their suckers to hold prey, are about five feet long, and are aggressive. This guy was lucky one of those Humboldt squid had not attacked him.
